title: Youssou N'Dour
summary: Youssou N'Dour (French: [jusu (ɛ)nduʁ]; also known as Youssou Madjiguène Ndour;[2] born 1 October 1959) is a Senegalese singer, songwriter, musician, composer, occasional actor, businessman, and politician. In 2004, Rolling Stone magazine described him as, "perhaps the most famous singer alive" in Senegal and much of Africa.[3] From April 2012 to September 2013, he was Senegal's Minister of Tourism.
